required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesic Effect of Erector Spinae Plane Block for Renal Colic Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Erector Spinae Plane Block Versus Intravenous Dexketoprofen-trometamol for Treatment of Reno-ureteral Colic: a Randomized Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Plane blocks have become very popular in recent years with the introduction of ultrasonography into the regional anesthesia and algology practice. Erector spinae plane (ESP) block involves the injection of local anesthetics between erector spinae muscles and transverse process of vertebrae and can block the dorsal and ventral rami of thoracolumbar spinal nerves.
The aim of this study was to evaluate the analgesic efficacy of the erector spine plane block for reno-ureteral colic.

secondary_outcome.description: A NRS involves asking the patient to rate his or her pain from 0 to 10 (11 point scale) with the understanding that 0 is equal to no pain and 10 is equal to worst possible pain. NRS score will be recorded after intervention at 5.,10.,15.,30.,45. and 60. minute

arm_group.arm_group_label: ultrasound guided erector spinae plane block
arm_group.description: 30 ml %0.25 ultrasound-guided erector spinae plane block at the level of T8

intervention.arm_group_label: ultrasound guided erector spinae plane block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologist's physiologic state I-II patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic pain
- bleeding disorders
- renal or hepatic insufficiency
- patients on chronic non-steroidal anti-inflammatory medications

reference.citation: Aydin ME, Ahiskalioglu A, Tekin E, Ozkaya F, Ahiskalioglu EO, Bayramoglu A. Relief of refractory renal colic in emergency department: A novel indication for ultrasound guided erector spinae plane block. Am J Emerg Med. 2019 Apr;37(4):794.e1-794.e3. doi: 10.1016/j.ajem.2018.12.042. Epub 2018 Dec 23.

Yayik AM, Ahiskalioglu A, Alici HA, Celik EC, Cesur S, Ahiskalioglu EO, Demirdogen SO, Karaca O, Adanur S. Less painful ESWL with ultrasound-guided quadratus lumborum block: a prospective randomized controlled study. Scand J Urol. 2019 Dec;53(6):411-416. doi: 10.1080/21681805.2019.1658636. Epub 2019 Sep 9.

Forero M, Adhikary SD, Lopez H, Tsui C, Chin KJ. The Erector Spinae Plane Block: A Novel Analgesic Technique in Thoracic Neuropathic Pain. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 2016 Sep-Oct;41(5):621-7. doi: 10.1097/AAP.0000000000000451.
